page.title: 06FARMING 2
page.content:
Mainly{hill farms} breeding Limousin and Charolais cattle for beef and Blackfaced,Mule,Half-bred and a few Suffolk ewes for mutton and wool.
{CROPS:}Hay and silage for Winter feed.Most farms grow a little barley,wheat or turnips.The two lowest lying farms grow about 200 acres each of grain,and some oil seed rape.
{MACHINES:}The farmers in the area are very mechanised using the whole range of modern equipment available.
{BUILDINGS:}Stone built farmsteading is now mainly redundant and used for storing odds and ends.Most build steel framed sheds to house implements,animals and winter fodder.
